property.name: ozone.container.cache.size
property.description: The open container is cached on the data node side. We maintain an LRU cache for caching the recently used containers. This setting controls the size of that cache.

property.name: ozone.container.cache.lock.stripes
property.description: Container DB open is an exclusive operation. We use a stripe lock to guarantee that different threads can open different container DBs concurrently, while for one container DB, only one thread can open it at the same time. This setting controls the lock stripes.

property.name: hdds.container.ipc.port
property.description: The ipc port number of container.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.datastream.enabled
property.description: It specifies whether to enable data stream of container.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.datastream.port
property.description: The datastream port number of container.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.datastream.random.port
property.description: Allocates a random free port for ozone container datastream. This is used only while running unit tests.

property.name: hdds.container.ipc.random.port
property.description: Allocates a random free port for ozone container. This is used only while running unit tests.

property.name: hdds.container.chunk.write.sync
property.description: Determines whether the chunk writes in the container happen as sync I/0 or buffered I/O operation.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.statemachinedata.sync.timeout
property.description: Timeout for StateMachine data writes by Ratis.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.statemachinedata.sync.retries
property.description:
Number of times the WriteStateMachineData op will be tried before failing. If the value is not configured, it will default to (hdds.ratis.rpc.slowness.timeout / hdds.container.ratis.statemachinedata.sync.timeout), which means that the WriteStatMachineData will be retried for every sync timeout until the configured slowness timeout is hit, after which the StateMachine will close down the pipeline.
If this value is set to -1, then this retries indefinitely. This might not be desirable since if due to persistent failure the WriteStateMachineData op was not able to complete for a long time, this might block the Ratis write pipeline.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.log.queue.num-elements
property.description: Limit for the number of operations in Ratis Log Worker.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.log.queue.byte-limit
property.description: Byte limit for Ratis Log Worker queue.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.log.appender.queue.num-elements
property.description: Limit for number of append entries in ratis leader's log appender queue.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.log.appender.queue.byte-limit
property.description: Byte limit for ratis leader's log appender queue.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.log.purge.gap
property.description: Purge gap between the last purged commit index and the current index, when the leader decides to purge its log.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.datanode.storage.dir
property.description: This directory is used for storing Ratis metadata like logs. If this is not set then default metadata dirs is used. A warning will be logged if this not set. Ideally, this should be mapped to a fast disk like an SSD.

property.name: ozone.scm.container.list.max.count
property.description: The max number of containers info could be included in response of ListContainer request.

property.name: hdds.datanode.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem HDDS data will be stored. The directories should be tagged with corresponding storage types ([SSD]/[DISK]/[ARCHIVE]/[RAM_DISK]) for storage policies. The default storage type will be DISK if the directory does not have a storage type tagged explicitly.

property.name: hdds.datanode.container.db.dir
property.description: Determines where the per-disk rocksdb instances will be stored. This setting is optional. If unspecified, then rocksdb instances are stored on the same disk as HDDS data. The directories should be tagged with corresponding storage types ([SSD]/[DISK]/[ARCHIVE]/[RAM_DISK]) for storage policies. The default storage type will be DISK if the directory does not have a storage type tagged explicitly. Ideally, this should be mapped to a fast disk like an SSD.

property.name: hdds.datanode.dir.du.reserved
property.description: Reserved space in bytes per volume. Always leave this much space free for non dfs use. Such as /dir1:100B, /dir2:200MB, means dir1 reserves 100 bytes and dir2 reserves 200 MB.

property.name: hdds.datanode.dir.du.reserved.percent
property.description: Percentage of volume that should be reserved. This space is left free for other usage. The value should be between 0-1. Such as 0.1 which means 10% of volume space will be reserved.

property.name: hdds.datanode.disk.balancer.enabled
property.description: If this property is set to true, then the Disk Balancer feature is enabled on Datanodes, and users can use this service. By default, this is disabled.

property.name: hdds.datanode.volume.choosing.policy
property.description: The class name of the policy for choosing volumes in the list of directories. Defaults to org.apache.hadoop.ozone.container.common.volume.CapacityVolumeChoosingPolicy. This volume choosing policy randomly chooses two volumes with remaining space and then picks the one with lower utilization.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.enabled
property.description: Ozone supports different kinds of replication pipelines. Ratis is one of the replication pipeline supported by ozone.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.ipc.port
property.description: The ipc port number of container for clients.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.admin.port
property.description: The ipc port number of container for admin requests.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.server.port
property.description: The ipc port number of container for server-server communication.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.ipc.random.port
property.description: Allocates a random free port for ozone ratis port for the container. This is used only while running unit tests.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.rpc.type
property.description: Ratis supports different kinds of transports like netty, GRPC, Hadoop RPC etc. This picks one of those for this cluster.

property.name: hdds.ratis.snapshot.threshold
property.description: Number of transactions after which a ratis snapshot should be taken.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.statemachine.max.pending.apply-transactions
property.description: Maximum number of pending apply transactions in a data pipeline. The default value is kept same as default snapshot threshold hdds.ratis.snapshot.threshold.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.num.write.chunk.threads.per.volume
property.description: Maximum number of threads in the thread pool that Datanode will use for writing replicated chunks. This is a per configured locations! (10 thread per disk by default).

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.leader.pending.bytes.limit
property.description: Limit on the total bytes of pending requests after which leader starts rejecting requests from client.

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.num.container.op.executors
property.description: Number of executors that will be used by Ratis to execute container ops.(10 by default).

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.segment.size
property.description: The size of the raft segment file used by Apache Ratis on datanodes. (64 MB by default)

property.name: hdds.container.ratis.segment.preallocated.size
property.description: The pre-allocated file size for raft segment used by Apache Ratis on datanodes. (4 MB by default)

property.name: hdds.ratis.server.retry-cache.timeout.duration
property.description: Retry Cache entry timeout for ratis server.

property.name: hdds.ratis.leader.election.minimum.timeout.duration
property.description: The minimum timeout duration for ratis leader election. Default is 5s.

property.name: hdds.raft.server.rpc.first-election.timeout
property.description: ratis Minimum timeout for the first election of a leader. If not configured, fallback to hdds.ratis.leader.election.minimum.timeout.duration.

property.name: hdds.node.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send node report. Each datanode periodically send node report to SCM. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: hdds.container.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send container report. Each datanode periodically send container report to SCM. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: hdds.pipeline.report.interval
property.description: Time interval of the datanode to send pipeline report. Each datanode periodically send pipeline report to SCM. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: hdds.prometheus.endpoint.enabled
property.description: Enable prometheus compatible metric page on the HTTP servers.

property.name: hdds.profiler.endpoint.enabled
property.description: Enable /prof java profiler servlet page on HTTP server.

property.name: ozone.administrators
property.description: Ozone administrator users delimited by the comma. If not set, only the user who launches an ozone service will be the admin user. This property must be set if ozone services are started by different users. Otherwise, the RPC layer will reject calls from other servers which are started by users not in the list.

property.name: ozone.administrators.groups
property.description: Ozone administrator groups delimited by the comma. This is the list of groups who can access admin only information from ozone. It is enough to either have the name defined in ozone.administrators or be directly or indirectly in a group defined in this property.

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.service.interval
property.description: Time interval of the block deleting service. The block deleting service runs on each datanode periodically and deletes blocks queued for deletion. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.service.timeout
property.description: A timeout value of block deletion service. If this is set greater than 0, the service will stop waiting for the block deleting completion after this time. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified, then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: ozone.block.deleting.service.workers
property.description: Number of workers executed of block deletion service. This configuration should be set to greater than 0.

property.name: ozone.UnsafeByteOperations.enabled
property.description: It specifies whether to use unsafe or safe buffer to byteString copy.

property.name: ozone.client.connection.timeout
property.description: Connection timeout for Ozone client in milliseconds.

property.name: ozone.client.socket.timeout
property.description: Socket timeout for Ozone client. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.client.elastic.byte.buffer.pool.max.size
property.description: The maximum total size of buffers that can be cached in the client-side ByteBufferPool. This pool is used heavily during EC read and write operations. Setting a limit prevents unbounded memory growth in long-lived rpc clients like the S3 Gateway. Once this limit is reached, used buffers are not put back to the pool and will be garbage collected.

property.name: ozone.key.deleting.limit.per.task
property.description: A maximum number of keys to be scanned by key deleting service per time interval in OM. Those keys are sent to delete metadata and generate transactions in SCM for next async deletion between SCM and DataNode.

property.name: ozone.snapshot.key.deleting.limit.per.task
property.description: The maximum number of deleted keys to be scanned by Snapshot Deleting Service per snapshot run.

property.name: ozone.om.service.ids
property.description: Comma-separated list of OM service Ids. This property allows the client to figure out quorum of OzoneManager address.

property.name: ozone.om.internal.service.id
property.description: Service ID of the Ozone Manager. If this is not set fall back to ozone.om.service.ids to find the service ID it belongs to.

property.name: ozone.om.nodes.EXAMPLEOMSERVICEID
property.description:
Comma-separated list of OM node Ids for a given OM service ID (eg. EXAMPLEOMSERVICEID). The OM service ID should be the value (one of the values if there are multiple) set for the parameter ozone.om.service.ids.
Decommissioned nodes (represented by node Ids in ozone.om.decommissioned.nodes config list) will be ignored and not included in the OM HA setup even if added to this list.
Unique identifiers for each OM Node, delimited by commas. This will be used by OzoneManagers in HA setup to determine all the OzoneManagers belonging to the same OMservice in the cluster. For example, if you used “omService1” as the OM service ID previously, and you wanted to use “om1”, “om2” and "om3" as the individual IDs of the OzoneManagers, you would configure a property ozone.om.nodes.omService1, and its value "om1,om2,om3".

property.name: ozone.om.decommissioned.nodes.EXAMPLEOMSERVICEID
property.description: Comma-separated list of OM node Ids which have been decommissioned. OMs present in this list will not be included in the OM HA ring.

property.name: ozone.om.node.id
property.description:
The ID of this OM node. If the OM node ID is not configured it is determined automatically by matching the local node's address with the configured address.
If node ID is not deterministic from the configuration, then it is set to default node id - om1.

property.name: ozone.om.address
property.description:
The address of the Ozone OM service. This allows clients to discover the address of the OM.
When HA mode is enabled, append the service ID and node ID to each OM property. For example: ozone.om.address.service1.om1

property.name: ozone.om.handler.count.key
property.description: The number of RPC handler threads for OM service endpoints.

property.name: ozone.om.read.threadpool
property.description: The number of threads in RPC server reading from the socket for OM service endpoints. This config overrides Hadoop configuration "ipc.server.read.threadpool.size" for Ozone Manager.

property.name: ozone.om.http-address
property.description:
The address and the base port where the OM web UI will listen on.
If the port is 0, then the server will start on a free port. However, it is best to specify a well-known port, so it is easy to connect and see the OM management UI.
When HA mode is enabled, append the service ID and node ID to each OM property. For example: ozone.om.http-address.service1.om1

property.name: ozone.om.http-bind-host
property.description:
The actual address the OM web server will bind to. If this optional the address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of ozone.om.http-address.
When HA mode is enabled, append the service ID and node ID to each OM property. For example: ozone.om.http-bind-host.service1.om1

property.name: ozone.om.http.enabled
property.description: Property to enable or disable OM web user interface.

property.name: ozone.om.https-address
property.description:
The address and the base port where the OM web UI will listen on using HTTPS. If the port is 0 then the server will start on a free port.
When HA mode is enabled, append the service ID and node ID to each OM property. For example: ozone.om.https-address.service1.om1

property.name: ozone.om.https-bind-host
property.description:
The actual address the OM web server will bind to using HTTPS. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of ozone.om.https-address.
When HA mode is enabled, append the service ID and node ID to each OM property. For example: ozone.om.https-bind-host.service1.om1

property.name: ozone.om.db.dirs
property.description:
Directory where the OzoneManager stores its metadata. This should be specified as a single directory. If the directory does not exist then the OM will attempt to create it.
If undefined, then the OM will log a warning and fallback to ozone.metadata.dirs. This fallback approach is not recommended for production environments.

property.name: ozone.om.db.dirs.permissions
property.description: Permissions for the metadata directories for Ozone Manager. The permissions have to be octal or symbolic. If the default permissions are not set then the default value of 750 will be used.

property.name: ozone.metadata.dirs
property.tag: OZONE, OM, SCM, CONTAINER, STORAGE, REQUIRED
property.description:
This setting is the fallback location for SCM, OM, Recon and DataNodes to store their metadata. This setting may be used only in test/PoC clusters to simplify configuration.
For production clusters or any time you care about performance, it is recommended that ozone.om.db.dirs, ozone.scm.db.dirs and hdds.container.ratis.datanode.storage.dir be configured separately.

property.name: ozone.path.deleting.limit.per.task
property.description: A maximum number of paths(dirs/files) to be deleted by directory deleting service per time interval.

property.name: ozone.metadata.dirs.permissions
property.description: Permissions for the metadata directories for fallback location for SCM, OM, Recon and DataNodes to store their metadata. The permissions have to be octal or symbolic. This is the fallback used in case the default permissions for OM,SCM,Recon,Datanode are not set.

property.name: ozone.metastore.rocksdb.statistics
property.description: The statistics level of the rocksdb store. If you use any value from org.rocksdb.StatsLevel (eg. ALL or EXCEPT_DETAILED_TIMERS), the rocksdb statistics will be exposed over JMX bean with the choosed setting. Set it to OFF to not initialize rocksdb statistics at all. Please note that collection of statistics could have 5-10% performance penalty. Check the rocksdb documentation for more details.

property.name: ozone.metastore.rocksdb.cf.write.buffer.size
property.description: The write buffer (memtable) size for each column family of the rocksdb store. Check the rocksdb documentation for more details.

property.name: ozone.scm.db.dirs
property.description:
Directory where the StorageContainerManager stores its metadata. This should be specified as a single directory. If the directory does not exist then the SCM will attempt to create it.
If undefined, then the SCM will log a warning and fallback to ozone.metadata.dirs. This fallback approach is not recommended for production environments.

property.name: ozone.scm.db.dirs.permissions
property.description: Permissions for the metadata directories for Storage Container Manager. The permissions can either be octal or symbolic. If the default permissions are not set then the default value of 750 will be used.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.client.address
property.description: The address of the Ozone SCM block client service. If not defined value of ozone.scm.client.address is used.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.client.bind.host
property.description: The hostname or IP address used by the SCM block client endpoint to bind.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.client.port
property.description: The port number of the Ozone SCM block client service.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.deletion.per.dn.distribution.factor
property.description: Factor with which number of delete blocks sent to each datanode in every interval. If total number of DNs are 100 and hdds.scm.block.deletion.per-interval.max is 500000 Then maximum 500000/(100/8) = 40000 blocks will be sent to each DN in every interval.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.deletion.per.dn.distribution.factor
property.description: Factor with which number of delete blocks sent to each datanode in every interval. If total number of DNs are 100 and hdds.scm.block.deletion.per-interval.max is 500000 Then maximum 500000/(100/8) = 40000 blocks will be sent to each DN in every interval.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.size
property.description: The default size of a scm block. This is maps to the default Ozone block size.

property.name: ozone.scm.sequence.id.batch.size
property.description: SCM allocates sequence id in a batch way. This property determines how many ids will be allocated in a single batch.

property.name: ozone.scm.chunk.size
property.description:
The chunk size for reading/writing chunk operations in bytes.
The chunk size defaults to 4MB. If the value configured is more than the maximum size (32MB), it will be reset to the maximum size (32MB). This maps to the network packet sizes and file write operations in the client to datanode protocol.
When tuning this parameter, flow control window parameter should be tuned accordingly. Refer to hdds.ratis.raft.grpc.flow.control.window for more information.

property.name: ozone.chunk.read.buffer.default.size
property.description:
The default read buffer size during read chunk operations when checksum is disabled. Chunk data will be cached in buffers of this capacity.
For chunk data with checksum, the read buffer size will be the same as the number of bytes per checksum (ozone.client.bytes.per.checksum) corresponding to the chunk.

property.name: ozone.chunk.read.mapped.buffer.threshold
property.description: The default read threshold to use memory mapped buffers.

property.name: ozone.chunk.read.mapped.buffer.max.count
property.description: The default max count of memory mapped buffers allowed for a DN. Default 0 means no mapped buffers allowed for data read.

property.name: ozone.scm.container.layout
property.description: Container layout defines how chunks, blocks and containers are stored on disk. Each chunk is stored separately with FILE_PER_CHUNK. All chunks of a block are stored in the same file with FILE_PER_BLOCK. The default is FILE_PER_BLOCK.

property.name: ozone.scm.client.address
property.description:
The address of the Ozone SCM client service. This is a required setting.
It is a string in the host:port format. The port number is optional and defaults to 9860.

property.name: ozone.scm.client.bind.host
property.description:
The hostname or IP address used by the SCM client endpoint to bind. This setting is used by the SCM only and never used by clients.
The setting can be useful in multi-homed setups to restrict the availability of the SCM client service to a specific interface.
The default is appropriate for most clusters.

property.name: ozone.scm.client.port
property.description: The port number of the Ozone SCM client service.

property.name: ozone.scm.keyvalue.container.deletion-choosing.policy
property.description: The policy used for choosing desired keyvalue containers for block deletion. Datanode selects some containers to process block deletion in a certain interval defined by ozone.block.deleting.service.interval. The number of containers to process in each interval is defined by ozone.block.deleting.container.limit.per.interval. This property is used to configure the policy applied while selecting containers. There are two policies supporting now: RandomContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy and TopNOrderedContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy. org.apache.hadoop.ozone.container.common.impl.RandomContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy implements a simply random policy that to return a random list of containers. org.apache.hadoop.ozone.container.common.impl.TopNOrderedContainerDeletionChoosingPolicy implements a policy that choosing top count number of containers in a pending-deletion-blocks's num based descending order.

property.name: ozone.scm.container.placement.impl
property.description: The full name of class which implements org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.PlacementPolicy. The class decides which datanode will be used to host the container replica. If not set, org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.container.placement.algorithms.SCMContainerPlacementRackAware will be used as default value.

property.name: ozone.scm.container.placement.ec.impl
property.description: The full name of class which implements org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.PlacementPolicy. The class decides which datanode will be used to host the container replica in EC mode. If not set, org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.container.placement.algorithms.SCMContainerPlacementRackScatter will be used as default value.

property.name: ozone.scm.pipeline.owner.container.count
property.description: Number of containers per owner per disk in a pipeline.

property.name: ozone.scm.pipeline.per.metadata.disk
property.description: Number of pipelines to be created per raft log disk.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.pipeline.limit
property.description: Max number of pipelines per datanode can be engaged in. Setting the value to 0 means the pipeline limit per dn will be determined by the no of metadata volumes reported per dn.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.disallow.same.peers
property.description: Disallows same set of datanodes to participate in multiple pipelines when set to true. Default is set to false.

property.name: ozone.scm.ratis.pipeline.limit
property.description: Upper limit for how many pipelines can be OPEN in SCM. 0 as default means there is no limit. Otherwise, the number is the limit of max amount of pipelines which are OPEN.

property.name: ozone.scm.pipeline.allocated.timeout
property.description: Timeout for every pipeline to stay in ALLOCATED stage. When pipeline is created, it should be at OPEN stage once pipeline report is successfully received by SCM. If a pipeline stays at ALLOCATED longer than the specified period of time, it should be scrubbed so that new pipeline can be created. This timeout is for how long pipeline can stay at ALLOCATED stage until it gets scrubbed.

property.name: ozone.scm.pipeline.leader-choose.policy
property.description: The policy used for choosing desired leader for pipeline creation. There are two policies supporting now: DefaultLeaderChoosePolicy, MinLeaderCountChoosePolicy. org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.pipeline.leader.choose.algorithms.DefaultLeaderChoosePolicy implements a policy that choose leader without depending on priority. org.apache.hadoop.hdds.scm.pipeline.leader.choose.algorithms.MinLeaderCountChoosePolicy implements a policy that choose leader which has the minimum exist leader count. In the future, we need to add policies which consider: 1. resource, the datanode with the most abundant cpu and memory can be made the leader 2. topology, the datanode nearest to the client can be made the leader

property.name: ozone.scm.container.size
property.description: Default container size used by Ozone. There are two considerations while picking this number. The speed at which a container can be replicated, determined by the network speed and the metadata that each container generates. So selecting a large number creates less SCM metadata, but recovery time will be more. 5GB is a number that maps to quick replication times in gigabit networks, but still balances the amount of metadata.

property.name: ozone.scm.container.lock.stripes
property.description: The number of stripes created for the container state manager lock.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.address
property.description:
The address of the Ozone SCM service used for internal communication between the DataNodes and the SCM.
It is a string in the host:port format. The port number is optional and defaults to 9861.
This setting is optional. If unspecified then the hostname portion is picked from the ozone.scm.client.address setting and the default service port of 9861 is chosen.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.bind.host
property.description: The hostname or IP address used by the SCM service endpoint to bind.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.id.dir
property.description: The path that datanodes will use to store the datanode ID. If this value is not set, then datanode ID is created under the metadata directory.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.port
property.description: The port number of the Ozone SCM service.

property.name: ozone.scm.dead.node.interval
property.description: The interval between heartbeats before a node is tagged as dead.

property.name: ozone.scm.handler.count.key
property.description:
The number of RPC handler threads for each SCM service endpoint.
The default is appropriate for small clusters (tens of nodes).
Set a value that is appropriate for the cluster size. Generally, HDFS recommends RPC handler count is set to 20 * log2(Cluster Size) with an upper limit of 200. However, Ozone SCM will not have the same amount of traffic as HDFS Namenode, so a value much smaller than that will work well too.
To specify handlers for individual RPC servers, set the following configuration properties instead: ---- RPC type ---- : ---- Configuration properties ---- SCMClientProtocolServer : 'ozone.scm.client.handler.count.key' SCMBlockProtocolServer : 'ozone.scm.block.handler.count.key' SCMDatanodeProtocolServer: 'ozone.scm.datanode.handler.count.key'

property.name: ozone.scm.client.handler.count.key
property.description: Used to set the number of RPC handlers used by Client to access SCM. The default value is 100.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.handler.count.key
property.description: Used to set the number of RPC handlers when accessing blocks. The default value is 100.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.handler.count.key
property.description: Used to set the number of RPC handlers used by DataNode to access SCM. The default value is 100.

property.name: ozone.scm.client.read.threadpool
property.description: The number of threads in RPC server reading from the socket used by Client to access SCM. This config overrides Hadoop configuration "ipc.server.read.threadpool.size" for SCMClientProtocolServer. The default value is 10.

property.name: ozone.scm.block.read.threadpool
property.description: The number of threads in RPC server reading from the socket when accessing blocks. This config overrides Hadoop configuration "ipc.server.read.threadpool.size" for SCMBlockProtocolServer. The default value is 10.

property.name: ozone.scm.datanode.read.threadpool
property.description: The number of threads in RPC server reading from the socket used by DataNode to access SCM. This config overrides Hadoop configuration "ipc.server.read.threadpool.size" for SCMDatanodeProtocolServer. The default value is 10.

property.name: hdds.heartbeat.interval
property.description: The heartbeat interval from a data node to SCM. Yes, it is not three but 30, since most data nodes will heart beating via Ratis heartbeats. If a client is not able to talk to a data node, it will notify OM/SCM eventually. So a 30 second HB seems to work. This assumes that replication strategy used is Ratis if not, this value should be set to something smaller like 3 seconds. ozone.scm.pipeline.close.timeout should also be adjusted accordingly, if the default value for this config is not used.

property.name: hdds.heartbeat.initial-interval
property.description: Heartbeat interval used during Datanode initialization for SCM.

property.name: hdds.heartbeat.recon.interval
property.description: The heartbeat interval from a Datanode to Recon.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.log.warn.interval.count
property.description: Defines how frequently we will log the missing of a heartbeat to SCM. For example in the default case, we will write a warning message for each ten consecutive heartbeats that we miss to SCM. This helps in reducing clutter in a data node log, but trade off is that logs will have less of this statement.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.rpc-timeout
property.description: Timeout value for the RPC from Datanode to SCM.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.rpc-retry-count
property.description: Retry count for the RPC from Datanode to SCM. The rpc-retry-interval is 1s by default. Make sure rpc-retry-count * (rpc-timeout + rpc-retry-interval) is less than hdds.heartbeat.interval.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.rpc-retry-interval
property.description: Retry interval for the RPC from Datanode to SCM. Make sure rpc-retry-count * (rpc-timeout + rpc-retry-interval) is less than hdds.heartbeat.interval.

property.name: ozone.scm.heartbeat.thread.interval
property.description:
When a heartbeat from the data node arrives on SCM, It is queued for processing with the time stamp of when the heartbeat arrived. There is a heartbeat processing thread inside SCM that runs at a specified interval. This value controls how frequently this thread is run.
There are some assumptions build into SCM such as this value should allow the heartbeat processing thread to run at least three times more frequently than heartbeats and at least five times more than stale node detection time. If you specify a wrong value, SCM will gracefully refuse to run. For more info look at the node manager tests in SCM.
In short, you don't need to change this.

property.name: ozone.key.preallocation.max.blocks
property.description: While allocating blocks from OM, this configuration limits the maximum number of blocks being allocated. This configuration ensures that the allocated block response do not exceed rpc payload limit. If client needs more space for the write, separate block allocation requests will be made.

property.name: ozone.client.list.cache

property.name: ozone.server.default.replication
property.description: Default replication value. The actual number of replications can be specified when writing the key. The default is used if replication is not specified when creating key or no default replication set at bucket. Supported values: For RATIS: 1, 3 For EC (Erasure Coding) supported format: {ECCodec}-{DataBlocks}-{ParityBlocks}-{ChunkSize} ECCodec: Codec for encoding stripe. Supported values : XOR, RS (Reed Solomon) DataBlocks: Number of data blocks in a stripe. ParityBlocks: Number of parity blocks in a stripe. ChunkSize: Chunk size in bytes. E.g. 1024k, 2048k etc. Supported combinations of {DataBlocks}-{ParityBlocks} : 3-2, 6-3, 10-4

property.name: ozone.server.default.replication.type

property.name: ozone.client.bucket.replication.config.refresh.time.ms
property.description: Default time period to refresh the bucket replication config in o3fs clients. Until the bucket replication config refreshed, client will continue to use existing replication config irrespective of whether bucket replication config updated at OM or not.

property.name: hdds.container.close.threshold
property.description: This determines the threshold to be used for closing a container. When the container used percentage reaches this threshold, the container will be closed. Value should be a positive, non-zero percentage in float notation (X.Yf), with 1.0f meaning 100%.

property.name: ozone.rest.client.http.connection.max

property.name: ozone.rest.client.http.connection.per-route.max

property.name: ozone.om.open.key.cleanup.service.interval
property.description: A background job that periodically checks open key entries and marks expired open keys for deletion. This entry controls the interval of this cleanup check. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.om.open.key.cleanup.service.timeout
property.description: A timeout value of open key cleanup service. If this is set greater than 0, the service will stop waiting for the open key deleting completion after this time. If timeout happens to a large proportion of open key deletion, this value needs to be increased or ozone.om.open.key.cleanup.limit.per.task should be decreased. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.om.open.key.expire.threshold
property.description: Controls how long an open key operation is considered active. Specifically, if a key has been open longer than the value of this config entry, that open key is considered as expired (e.g. due to client crash). Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.om.lease.hard.limit
property.description: Controls how long an open hsync key is considered as active. Specifically, if a hsync key has been open longer than the value of this config entry, that open hsync key is considered as expired (e.g. due to client crash). Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.om.open.key.cleanup.limit.per.task
property.description: The maximum number of open keys to be identified as expired and marked for deletion by one run of the open key cleanup service on the OM. This property is used to throttle the actual number of open key deletions on the OM.

property.name: ozone.om.open.mpu.cleanup.service.interval
property.description: A background job that periodically checks inactive multipart info send multipart upload abort requests for them. This entry controls the interval of this cleanup check. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.om.open.mpu.cleanup.service.timeout
property.description: A timeout value of multipart upload cleanup service. If this is set greater than 0, the service will stop waiting for the multipart info abort completion after this time. If timeout happens to a large proportion of multipart aborts, this value needs to be increased or ozone.om.open.key.cleanup.limit.per.task should be decreased. Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.om.open.mpu.expire.threshold
property.description: Controls how long multipart upload is considered active. Specifically, if a multipart info has been ongoing longer than the value of this config entry, that multipart info is considered as expired (e.g. due to client crash). Unit could be defined with postfix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.om.open.mpu.parts.cleanup.limit.per.task

property.name: ozone.om.unflushed.transaction.max.count

property.name: hdds.x509.rootca.private.key.file

This public key is later used when initializing SCM to sign certificates as the root certificate authority. When only the private key is specified the public key is read from the external certificate. property.name: hdds.x509.ca.rotation.enabled

property.name: hdds.x509.rootca.certificate.polling.interval

Every time the specified time duration elapses, the clients send a request to the SCMs to see if a new root ca certificate was generated. property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.segment.preallocated.size

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.request.timeout

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.ratis.server.retry.cache.timeout
property.description: Retry Cache entry timeout for SCM's Ratis server.

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.raft.server.rpc.first-election.timeout

property.name: ozone.scm.ha.grpc.deadline.interval

property.name: ozone.s3g.kerberos.keytab.file
property.description: The keytab file used by S3Gateway daemon to login as its service principal. The principal name is configured with ozone.s3g.kerberos.principal.

property.description: The S3Gateway service principal. Ex: s3g/_HOST@REALM.COM

property.name: hadoop.http.idle_timeout.ms
property.description: OM/SCM/DN/S3GATEWAY Server connection timeout in milliseconds.

property.name: ozone.om.s3.grpc.server_enabled
property.description: Property to enable or disable Ozone Manager gRPC endpoint for clients. Right now, it is used by S3 Gateway only.

property.name: ozone.om.grpc.maximum.response.length
property.description: OM/S3GATEWAY OMRequest, OMResponse over grpc max message length (bytes).

property.name: ozone.om.grpc.read.thread.num

property.name: ozone.om.grpc.bossgroup.size
property.description: OM grpc server netty boss event group size.

property.name: ozone.om.grpc.workergroup.size
property.description: OM grpc server netty worker event group size.

property.name: ozone.default.bucket.layout
property.description: Default bucket layout used by Ozone Manager during bucket creation when a client does not specify the bucket layout option. Supported values are OBJECT_STORE and FILE_SYSTEM_OPTIMIZED. OBJECT_STORE: This layout allows the bucket to behave as a pure object store and will not allow interoperability between S3 and FS APIs. FILE_SYSTEM_OPTIMIZED: This layout allows the bucket to support atomic rename/delete operations and also allows interoperability between S3 and FS APIs. Keys written via S3 API with a "/" delimiter will create intermediate directories.

property.name: ozone.client.max.ec.stripe.write.retries
property.description: When EC stripe write failed, client will request to allocate new block group and write the failed stripe into new block group. If the same stripe failure continued in newly acquired block group also, then it will retry by requesting to allocate new block group again. This configuration is used to limit these number of retries. By default the number of retries are 10.

property.name: ozone.client.ec.grpc.retries.enabled
property.description: To enable Grpc client retries for EC.

property.name: ozone.client.ec.grpc.retries.max
property.description: The maximum attempts GRPC client makes before failover.

property.name: ozone.audit.log.debug.cmd.list.omaudit
property.description: A comma separated list of OzoneManager commands that are written to the OzoneManager audit logs only if the audit log level is debug. Ex: "ALLOCATE_BLOCK,ALLOCATE_KEY,COMMIT_KEY".

property.name: ozone.audit.log.debug.cmd.list.scmaudit
property.description: A comma separated list of SCM commands that are written to the SCM audit logs only if the audit log level is debug. Ex: "GET_VERSION,REGISTER,SEND_HEARTBEAT".

property.name: ozone.audit.log.debug.cmd.list.dnaudit
property.description: A comma separated list of Datanode commands that are written to the DN audit logs only if the audit log level is debug. Ex: "CREATE_CONTAINER,READ_CONTAINER,UPDATE_CONTAINER".

property.name: ozone.om.multitenancy.enabled
property.description: Enable S3 Multi-Tenancy. If disabled, all S3 multi-tenancy requests are rejected.

property.name: ozone.om.multitenancy.ranger.sync.interval
property.description: Determines how often the Multi-Tenancy Ranger background sync thread service should run. Background thread periodically checks Ranger policies and roles created by Multi-Tenancy feature. And overwrites them if obvious discrepancies are detected. Value should be set with a unit suffix (ns,ms,s,m,h,d)

property.name: ozone.om.multitenancy.ranger.sync.timeout
property.description: The timeout for each Multi-Tenancy Ranger background sync thread run. If the timeout has been reached, a warning message will be logged.

property.name: ozone.client.fs.default.bucket.layout
property.description: Default bucket layout value used when buckets are created using OFS. Supported values are LEGACY and FILE_SYSTEM_OPTIMIZED. FILE_SYSTEM_OPTIMIZED: This layout allows the bucket to support atomic rename/delete operations and also allows interoperability between S3 and FS APIs. Keys written via S3 API with a "/" delimiter will create intermediate directories.

property.name: ozone.om.namespace.s3.strict
property.description: Ozone namespace should follow S3 naming rule by default. However this parameter allows the namespace to support non-S3 compatible characters.

property.name: ozone.om.container.location.cache.size
property.description: The size of the container locations cache in Ozone Manager. This cache allows Ozone Manager to populate block locations in key-read responses without calling SCM, thus increases Ozone Manager read performance.

property.name: ozone.om.container.location.cache.ttl
property.description: The time to live for container location cache in Ozone.

property.name: ozone.om.enable.ofs.shared.tmp.dir
property.description: Enable shared ofs tmp directory ofs://tmp. Allows a root tmp directory with sticky-bit behaviour.

property.name: ozone.fs.listing.page.size
property.description: Listing page size value used by client for listing number of items on fs related sub-commands output. Kindly set this config value responsibly to avoid high resource usage. Maximum value restricted is 5000 for optimum performance.

property.name: ozone.fs.listing.page.size.max
property.description: Maximum listing page size value enforced by server for listing items on fs related sub-commands output. Kindly set this config value responsibly to avoid high resource usage. Maximum value restricted is 5000 for optimum performance.

property.name: ozone.recon.nssummary.flush.db.max.threshold
property.description: Maximum threshold number of entries to hold in memory for NSSummary task in hashmap before flushing to recon rocks DB namespaceSummaryTable

property.name: ozone.recon.containerkey.flush.db.max.threshold
property.description: Maximum threshold number of entries to hold in memory for Container Key Mapper task in hashmap before flushing to recon rocks DB containerKeyTable

property.name: ozone.recon.filesizecount.flush.db.max.threshold
property.description: Maximum threshold number of entries to hold in memory for File Size Count task in hashmap before flushing to recon derby DB

property.name: ozone.recon.task.reprocess.max.iterators
property.description: Maximum number of iterator threads to use for parallel table iteration during reprocess

property.name: ozone.recon.task.reprocess.max.workers
property.description: Maximum number of worker threads to use for parallel table processing during reprocess

property.name: ozone.recon.task.reprocess.max.keys.in.memory
property.description: Maximum number of keys to batch in memory before handing to worker threads during parallel reprocess

property.name: ozone.recon.heatmap.provider
property.description: Fully qualified heatmap provider implementation class name. If this value is not set, then HeatMap feature will be disabled and not exposed in Recon UI. Please refer Ozone doc for more details regarding the implementation of "org.apache.hadoop.ozone.recon.heatmap.IHeatMapProvider" interface.

property.name: ozone.recon.heatmap.enable
property.description: To enable/disable recon heatmap feature. Along with this config, user must also provide the implementation of "org.apache.hadoop.ozone.recon.heatmap.IHeatMapProvider" interface and configure in "ozone.recon.heatmap.provider" configuration.

property.name: ozone.fs.datastream.enabled
property.description: To enable/disable filesystem write via ratis streaming.

property.name: ozone.fs.datastream.auto.threshold
property.description: A threshold to auto select datastream to write files in OzoneFileSystem.

property.name: ozone.hbase.enhancements.allowed
property.description:
When set to false, server-side HBase enhancement-related Ozone (experimental) features are disabled (not allowed to be enabled) regardless of whether those configs are set.
Here is the list of configs and values overridden when this config is set to false: 1. ozone.fs.hsync.enabled = false
A warning message will be printed if any of the above configs are overridden by this.

property.name: ozone.fs.hsync.enabled
property.description: Enable hsync/hflush on the Ozone Manager and/or client side. Disabled by default. Can be enabled only when ozone.hbase.enhancements.allowed = true

property.name: ozone.om.lease.soft.limit
property.description: Hsync soft limit lease period.

property.name: ozone.recon.scm.snapshot.task.initial.delay
property.description: Initial delay in MINUTES by Recon to request SCM DB Snapshot.

property.name: ozone.recon.scm.snapshot.task.interval.delay
property.description: Interval in MINUTES by Recon to request SCM DB Snapshot.

property.name: ozone.recon.container.health.use.scm.report
property.description: Feature flag to enable ContainerHealthTaskV2 which uses SCM's ReplicationManager as the single source of truth for container health states. When enabled, V2 task will sync container health states directly from SCM instead of computing them locally. This provides more accurate and consistent container health reporting. Default is false (uses legacy implementation).

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.compaction.dag.max.time.allowed
property.description: Maximum time a snapshot is allowed to be in compaction DAG before it gets pruned out by pruning daemon. Uses millisecond by default when no time unit is specified.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.prune.compaction.backup.batch.size
property.description: Prune SST files in Compaction backup directory in batches every ozone.om.snapshot.compaction.dag.prune.daemon.run.interval.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.compaction.dag.prune.daemon.run.interval
property.description: Interval at which compaction DAG pruning daemon thread is running to remove older snapshots with compaction history from compaction DAG. Uses millisecond by default when no time unit is specified.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.diff.db.dir
property.description:
Directory where the OzoneManager stores the snapshot diff related data. This should be specified as a single directory. If the directory does not exist then the OM will attempt to create it.
If undefined, then the OM will log a warning and fallback to ozone.metadata.dirs. This fallback approach is not recommended for production environments.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.cache.max.size
property.description:
Size of the OM Snapshot LRU cache.
This is a soft limit of open OM Snapshot RocksDB instances that will be held. The actual number of cached instance could exceed this limit if more than this number of snapshot instances are still in-use by snapDiff or other tasks.

property.name: ozone.om.db.max.open.files
property.description: Max number of open files that OM RocksDB will open simultaneously Essentially sets `max_open_files` config for the active OM RocksDB instance. This will limit the total number of files opened by OM db. Default is -1 which is unlimited and gives max performance. If you are certain that your ulimit will always be bigger than number of files in the database, set max_open_files to -1, or else set it to a value lesser than or equal to ulimit.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.db.max.open.files
property.description: Max number of open files for each snapshot db present in the snapshot cache. Essentially sets `max_open_files` config for RocksDB instances opened for Ozone snapshots. This will limit the total number of files opened by a snapshot db thereby limiting the total number of open file handles by snapshot dbs. Max total number of open handles = (snapshot cache size * max open files)

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.force.full.diff
property.description: Flag to always perform full snapshot diff (can be slow) without using the optimised compaction DAG.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.diff.disable.native.libs
property.description: Flag to perform snapshot diff without using native libs(can be slow).

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.diff.max.page.size
property.description: Maximum number of entries to be returned in a single page of snap diff report.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.diff.thread.pool.size
property.description: Maximum numbers of concurrent snapshot diff jobs are allowed.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.diff.job.default.wait.time
property.description: Default wait time returned to client to wait before retrying snap diff request. Uses millisecond by default when no time unit is specified.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.diff.max.jobs.purge.per.task
property.description: Maximum number of snapshot diff jobs to be purged per snapDiff clean up run.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.diff.job.report.persistent.time
property.description: Maximum time a successful snapshot diff job and its report will be persisted. Uses millisecond by default when no time unit is specified.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.diff.cleanup.service.run.interval
property.description: Interval at which snapshot diff clean up service will run. Uses millisecond by default when no time unit is specified.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.diff.cleanup.service.timeout
property.description: Timeout for snapshot diff clean up service. Uses millisecond by default when no time unit is specified.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.cache.cleanup.service.run.interval
property.description: Interval at which snapshot cache clean up will run. Uses millisecond by default when no time unit is specified.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.load.native.lib
property.description: Load native library for performing optimized snapshot diff.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.diff.max.allowed.keys.changed.per.job
property.description: Max numbers of keys changed allowed for a snapshot diff job.

property.name: hdds.secret.key.file.name
property.description: Name of file which stores symmetric secret keys for token signatures.

property.name: hdds.secret.key.expiry.duration
property.description: The duration for which symmetric secret keys issued by SCM are valid. Secret key is used to sign delegation tokens signed by OM, so the secret key must be valid for at least (ozone.manager.delegation.token.max-lifetime + hdds.secret.key.rotate.duration + ozone.manager.delegation.remover.scan.interval) time to guarantee that delegation tokens can be verified by OM. Considering the default value of three properties mentioned and rounding up to days, this property's default value, in combination with hdds.secret.key.rotate.duration=1d, results in 9 secret keys (for the last 9 days) are kept valid at any point of time. If any of ozone.manager.delegation.token.max-lifetime, hdds.secret.key.rotate.duration or ozone.manager.delegation.remover.scan.interval value is changed, this property should be checked, and updated accordingly if necessary.

property.name: hdds.secret.key.rotate.duration
property.description: The duration that SCM periodically generate a new symmetric secret keys.

property.name: hdds.secret.key.rotate.check.duration
property.description: The duration that SCM periodically checks if it's time to generate new symmetric secret keys. This config has an impact on the practical correctness of secret key expiry and rotation period. For example, if hdds.secret.key.rotate.duration=1d and hdds.secret.key.rotate.check.duration=10m, the actual key rotation will happen each 1d +/- 10m.

property.name: hdds.secret.key.algorithm
property.description: The algorithm that SCM uses to generate symmetric secret keys. A valid algorithm is the one supported by KeyGenerator, as described at https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/security/StandardNames.html#KeyGenerator.

property.name: ozone.om.upgrade.quota.recalculate.enabled
property.description: quota recalculation trigger when upgrade to the layout version QUOTA. while upgrade, re-calculation of quota used will block write operation to existing buckets till this operation is completed.

property.name: ozone.om.max.buckets
property.description: maximum number of buckets across all volumes.

property.name: ozone.volume.io.percentiles.intervals.seconds
property.description: This setting specifies the interval (in seconds) for monitoring percentile performance metrics. It helps in tracking the read and write performance of DataNodes in real-time, allowing for better identification and analysis of performance issues.

property.name: hdds.datanode.dns.interface
property.description: The name of the Network Interface from which a Datanode should report its IP address. e.g. eth2. This setting may be required for some multi-homed nodes where the Datanodes are assigned multiple hostnames and it is desirable for the Datanodes to use a non-default hostname.

property.name: hdds.datanode.dns.nameserver
property.description: The host name or IP address of the name server (DNS) which a Datanode should use to determine its own host name.

property.name: hdds.datanode.hostname
property.description: Optional. The hostname for the Datanode containing this configuration file. Will be different for each machine. Defaults to current hostname.

property.name: hdds.datanode.use.datanode.hostname
property.description: Whether Datanodes should use Datanode hostnames when connecting to other Datanodes for data transfer.

property.name: hdds.xframe.enabled
property.description: If true, then enables protection against clickjacking by returning X_FRAME_OPTIONS header value set to SAMEORIGIN. Clickjacking protection prevents an attacker from using transparent or opaque layers to trick a user into clicking on a button or link on another page.

property.name: hdds.xframe.value
property.description: This configration value allows user to specify the value for the X-FRAME-OPTIONS. The possible values for this field are DENY, SAMEORIGIN and ALLOW-FROM. Any other value will throw an exception when Datanodes are starting up.

property.name: hdds.metrics.session-id
property.description: Get the user-specified session identifier. The default is the empty string. The session identifier is used to tag metric data that is reported to some performance metrics system via the org.apache.hadoop.metrics API. The session identifier is intended, in particular, for use by Hadoop-On-Demand (HOD) which allocates a virtual Hadoop cluster dynamically and transiently. HOD will set the session identifier by modifying the mapred-site.xml file before starting the cluster. When not running under HOD, this identifer is expected to remain set to the empty string.

property.name: hdds.datanode.kerberos.principal
property.description: The Datanode service principal. This is typically set to dn/_HOST@REALM.TLD. Each Datanode will substitute _HOST with its own fully qualified hostname at startup. The _HOST placeholder allows using the same configuration setting on all Datanodes.

property.name: hdds.datanode.kerberos.keytab.file
property.description: The keytab file used by each Datanode daemon to login as its service principal. The principal name is configured with hdds.datanode.kerberos.principal.

property.name: hdds.metrics.percentiles.intervals
property.description: Comma-delimited set of integers denoting the desired rollover intervals (in seconds) for percentile latency metrics on the Datanode. By default, percentile latency metrics are disabled.

property.name: net.topology.node.switch.mapping.impl
property.description: The default implementation of the DNSToSwitchMapping. It invokes a script specified in net.topology.script.file.name to resolve node names. If the value for net.topology.script.file.name is not set, the default value of DEFAULT_RACK is returned for all node names.

property.name: ozone.om.edekcacheloader.interval.ms
property.description: When KeyProvider is configured, the interval time of warming up edek cache on OM starts up. All edeks will be loaded from KMS into provider cache. The edek cache loader will try to warm up the cache until succeed or OM leaves active state.

property.name: ozone.om.edekcacheloader.initial.delay.ms
property.description: When KeyProvider is configured, the time delayed until the first attempt to warm up edek cache on OM start up.

property.name: ozone.om.edekcacheloader.max-retries
property.description: When KeyProvider is configured, the max retries allowed to attempt warm up edek cache if none of key successful on OM start up.

property.name: ozone.om.hierarchical.resource.locks.soft.limit
property.description: Soft limit for number of lock objects that could be idle in the pool.

property.name: ozone.om.hierarchical.resource.locks.hard.limit
property.description: Maximum number of lock objects that could be present in the pool.

property.name: ozone.om.snapshot.local.data.manager.service.interval
property.description: Interval for cleaning up orphan snapshot local data versions corresponding to snapshots
